intro: Eriogonum elatum, commonly known as the tall buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and branched. Eriogonum elatum plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and wildlife.
